oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Tennessee crop map of cotton
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Maps; Farming; Cotton; Boundaries
Agriculture; Maps
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Agricultural map, in combination with the written statistical information, reflecting cotton crop yields, acres under cultivation, and the underlying fertility of the soil and its adaptability to the growing of cotton. Map is from Tennessee: Its Resources, Capacities, and Development.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Godwin, D.G.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: D. G. Godwin, the Commissioner of the Tennessee Department of Agriculture, felt the need to publish this graphically illustrated book to inform homeseekers, capitalists, and students of the products, resources, and capabilities of Tennessee. In doing so, he was following the historical mandate that had evolved for the Department. Most statistical information that was employed by Godwin came from the 1890 Federal Census figures.
